    • Method Detail

      • generateToken

        public void generateToken(CardTokenisationRequest request)
        This method is used to generate a card token.

        It takes a CardTokenisationRequest as the argument and it will perform a HTTP Post request to generate the token. it is important to you select an environment and provide your public key before calling tis method. Moreover it is important to set a callback CheckoutAPIClient.OnTokenGenerated so you can receive the token back.

        If you are using the UI of the SDK this method will be called automatically, but you still need to provide the callback, key and environment when initialising this class

        Parameters:
        request - Custom request body to be used in the HTTP call.

      • generateGooglePayToken

        public void generateGooglePayToken(java.lang.String payload)
                            throws org.json.JSONException
        This method used to create a token that can be used in a server environment to create a charge. It will take a GooglePay payload in JSON string format. The payload is usually generated in the handlePaymentSuccess method shown in the Google Pay example from Google (token.getToken())
        Parameters:
        payload - Google Pay Payload
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • setTokenListener

        public CheckoutAPIClient setTokenListener(CheckoutAPIClient.OnTokenGenerated listener)
        This method used to set a callback for 3D Secure handling.
        Returns:
        CheckoutAPIClient to allow method chaining

      • setGooglePayListener

        public CheckoutAPIClient setGooglePayListener(CheckoutAPIClient.OnGooglePayTokenGenerated listener)
        This method used to set a callback for Google Pay handling.
        Returns:
        CheckoutAPIClient to allow method chaining
